sen.j: 茶量（ちゃりょう）は煎茶道で使用される道具の一つ。
sen.e: Charyo is a type of utensil used in senchado (the way of brewed green tea).

sen.j: 流派によって「茶合」「仙媒（せんばい）」「茶則」「茶計」とも言われる。
sen.e: Depending on styles, it is called 'chago', 'senbai', 'chasoku' and 'chakei'.
sen.cmt: 用語集では「茶合」「仙媒（せんばい）」「茶則」「茶計」のすべての英訳に茶量と同じく(scoops for green tea leaves)と補足が入っていたため、ここでは個々への補足は省きました。

sen.e: However many of 'karamono' is not suited for the use as they are conversion of bamboo used for ude-makura (arm rest to avoid staining sleeve) that is used in Calligraphy, in mainland China.

sen.j: 江戸時代中期、売茶翁が茶葉の量と投入の便宜のためにこの道具を考案したというのが定説となっている。
sen.e: An established theory for the origin of charyo is that the utensil was designed by Baisa-o (a monk of Obaku Sect) in the middle of the Edo period for convenience of measuring and pouring in of tea leaves.

sen.e: An established theory for the origin of charyo is that the utensil was designed by Baisao (a monk of Obakushu sect) in the middle of the Edo period for convenience of measuring and pouring in of tea leaves.

sen.j: 質素清貧をモットーとする売茶翁考案のため、竹を2つか3つ、適当な大きさに割っただけの簡単な物であったといわれる。
sen.e: Charyo is designed by Baisa-o whose motto was simplicity and honorable poverty therefore it is believed that charyo was a simple utensil of bamboo that was divided 2-3times in appropriate size.
